data.benefits: Scheme provides Financial assistance for engagement of design consultants for design interventions and expenses related to development ofprototype/product upto Rs. 40 lakh.
data.eligibility: All manufacturing MSMEs have valid Udyam Registration Certificate are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
Unit must  have a valid UAM or Udyam Registration.
Unit must be a profitable entity preferably in the at least one year out of last three financial years.
data.beneficiaries: All manufacturing MSMEs have valid Udyam Registration Certificate are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
Unit must  have a valid UAM or Udyam Registration.
Unit must be a profitable entity preferably in the at least one year out of last three financial years.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to promote a culture of innovation and creative problem solving through knowledge sharing and collaboration amongst industry.
data.objective: The objective of this component is to bring Indian manufacturing sector and Design expertise/ Design fraternity on to a common platform.
data.description:
Scheme provides capital subsidy for engagement of design consultants for design interventions and expenses related to development of prototype/product : 

  • Design Project : 
  • For Micro : 75% of the total project cost 
  • For Small and Medium : 60% of the total project cost 

Student Design Project : 

  • For the student design projects : 75% of the total project cost upto max. of Rs. 2.5 lakh
data.how_to_apply:
A. MSMEs may submit their design projects to the nominated IAs. 
B. MSME will submit the proposal for Student Design project to the Implementation Agency under the Design Scheme, through the portal of the scheme (https://innovative.msme.gov.in).
data.funding_facilitator: Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru, IITs (Kanpur, Indore, BHU, Roorkee, Ropar, Bhubaneshwar), NITs (Tiruchirappalli, Warangal, Silchar, Arunachal Pradesh, Jaipur, Allahabad, J&K, Bhopal, Nagpur, Calicut, Kurukshetra, Surathkal, Raipur), Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), National Institute of Technology (NIT), Reputed Industrial Design Institutes, Tool Rooms etc.
data.funding_mechanism:
The applicant will get the grant in 3 stages for Design project: 

  • Stage 1 – Strategy & Concept - 40% 
  • Stage 2 – Detail Design - 30% 
  • Stage 3 – Successful Completion of the prototype/product and Final Report submission - 30% 

The funding grant will be reimbursed in 2 stages, in the following manner for student design project : 

  • Stage 1 – Application approval - 50% 
  • Stage 2 – Successful Completion and Final Report Submission - 50%
data.additional_info:
• The financial assistance under this component will be available to those who have not availed any Central/State Government subsidy for the same purpose. 
  • The MSME Innovative scheme is designed by integrating three components of CLCSTUS (viz., Incubation, Design & IPR) schemes to create CHAMPIONS, where each component can have interoperability with other components during the phases of intervention to enhance capacities/capabilities of champion MSMEs. 
  • MSME can have opportunity to suitably interlink benefits among three components during the period/stage of implementation. 
  1. There are some options of various combinations like- 
    Only Incubation OR Only Design OR Only IPR 
  2. Incubation-Design-IPR 
  3. Incubation-Design 
  4. Incubation to IPR 
  5. Design-IPR MSME can apply for any one of the above combinations. 
  • The financial assistance will be applicable for availing the benefits as per the individual scheme component. 
  • One scheme may enter from one completed gate to the gate of another scheme as per the requirement of the MSME, while ensuring that the original scheme it enrolled for is taken to the natural conclusion. 
  • At the time of applying for the next scheme, the applicant should adhere to the respective scheme guidelines for that particular scheme.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. University affiliation       
2. Udyam Registration Certificate 
2. AICTE approval letter/Certificate      
3. Other/NABL accreditation       
4. Last 2 years, audited annual accounts with the auditor’s report 
5. Proof of No. of students enrolled during previous two years  
6. Audited financial statements of Business incubators (B.I.)
